meanings.definition: The behavior or attitudes of a snob.
meanings.sent1: Her snobbism was evident in the way she looked down on others.
meanings.sent2: His snobbism made it difficult for him to make friends outside his social circle.
meanings.sent3: Despite her snobbism, she found herself enjoying the company of people from different backgrounds.
meanings.sent4: The snobbism in the room was so thick, you could almost touch it.
meanings.sent5: The snobbism of the elite club members was palpable as they ignored everyone else.

meanings.definition: The belief in the superiority of one's own social class.
meanings.sent1: His snobbism led him to think he was better than everyone else.
meanings.sent2: The snobbism of the upper class was evident in their exclusive gatherings.
meanings.sent3: Despite his snobbism, he secretly admired the kindness of those from different backgrounds.
meanings.sent4: The snobbism of the wealthy was like a barrier between them and the rest of society.
meanings.sent5: The snobbism of the aristocracy was so ingrained, they couldn't see the value in others.
